channel.title: 2019 GBG Build and Hackathon - Kansas City
channel.description:
We just hosted our annual GoBabyGo Community Build and Hackathon here in Kansas City! This is the result of a partnership between the VarietyKC Children's Charity and FIRST Robotics Team 1939 from the Barstow School.
We built 22 cars including 6 specialized cars, one of which was (as far as we know) the first time a hoverboard has been converted to a GoBabyGo car. We built for 3 kids that were over the age of 10 at this build and provides some interesting challenges. Also, received some great news coverage. Check out the links below.
[KCTV 5 Story](https://www.kctv5.com/news/local_news/robotics-students-build-mobility-devices-for-special-needs-children/video_f3af50fe-f897-51b9-a747-eb7e74dc19d8.html)
[KMBC 9 Story (This story is on the national MSN site)](https://www.msn.com/en-us/video/news/high-school-robotics-teams-give-new-rides-to-children-who-use-wheelchairs/vi-BBXggqJ?fbclid=IwAR29F94CtrCNYh8zDp1ITv4rL15mrbu4Jjq6wCf4AoaTIk7R1uO_gL3li-0)
[FOX 4 Story](https://fox4kc.com/2019/11/23/barstow-robotics-team-students-build-customized-cars-for-children-with-special-needs/)

item.title: 2019 GBG Build and Hackathon - Kansas City
item.dc:creator: GaryLiseo
item.description:
Glad to hear your team is continuing to help kids with Go Baby Go. I remember when your team was with us (CCSU) at the ITEEA conference in KC
